definition.en: An enclosed and/or covered structure, above and/or below ground, intended either for the shelter of persons, animals or things, or for the production of economic goods or the provision of services, and refers to any structure permanently constructed or erected on its site.
This data types includes the geometry of the building and metadata information about which element of the building was captured and how.
Data type grouping the 3D geometry of a building or building part and the metadata information attached to this geometry.

usage.en: More information about LoD can be found via this link: https://docs.ogc.org/is/20-010/20-010.html#toc0

definition.en: Data type grouping the specific metadata attached to the 3D geometry, when provided by a LoD 1 representation.
Data type grouping the specific metadata attached to the 3D geometry, when provided by a LoD2 representation.
Data type grouping the specific metadata attached to the 3D geometry, when provided by a LoD3 representation.
Data type grouping the specific metadata attached to the 3D geometry, when provided by a LoD4 representation.

The smallest unit within a building that is suitable and adapted for residential, commercial or recreational purposes and which is accessible from the outside or from a common area. A building unit is atomic, functionally independent, and may be separately sold, rented out, inherited, etc. In addition, a building unit can also be a common part.
This data type enables to detail the current use(s).
This data type includes the different possible ways to define the date of an event.
Vertically-constrained dimensional property consisting of an absolute measure referenced to a well-defined surface which is commonly taken as origin (geoïd, water level, etc.).
The location where the building (unit) can be entered or exited.
Reference to an external information system containing any piece of information related to the spatial object.
Proper noun applied to a real world entity.

usage.en: This can be substituted by LangString

definition.en: Vertical distance (measured or estimated) between a low reference and a high reference.
A representation of a unit.
An internal construction (generally or small size) or an internal device, serving the building.

usage.en: Example: stairs, lift

definition.en: The official code of the language.
Identifier of an object broken down into its parts.
Activity hosted within the building. This attribute addresses mainly the buildings hosting human activities.

usage.en: This attribute aims to fulfill management requirements, such as computation of population or spatial planning ; this classification aims to be exhaustive for the functional buildings hosting human activities.

definition.en: Date of construction.
Date of demolition.
Date of renovation.
Vertically-constrained dimensional property consisting of an absolute measure referenced to a well-defined surface which is commonly taken as origin (geoïd, water level, etc.).
Element of the building that was captured by (X,Y) coordinates.
Element of the real world object that was captured by the (X,Y) coordinates of the LoD1 Multisurface or Solid geometry.

usage.en:
Example: footprint, roof edge.

Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Horizontal Geometry Reference code list.

definition.en: Date of construction.
Date of demolition
Date of renovation.
Activity hosted within the building unit. This attribute addresses mainly the building units hosting human activities.
A date and time of any point of the event, between its beginning and its end.
Building of which building unit(s) are being a part.

usage.en: The set of two distinct volumes united by a gallery/walkway is nevertheless considered as a single building. Two volumes separated by a footbridge (which is above a public road) are considered as two separate buildings which are located in different sites (because they are different plots).

definition.en: The Building(s) related to the CadastralParcel.
Characteristic of the building that makes it generally of interest for mappings applications. The characteristic may be related to the physical aspect and/or to the function of the building.

usage.en:
This attribute focuses on the physical aspect (facade) of the building; however, this physical aspect is often expressed as a function (e.g. stadium, silo, windmill); this attribute aims to fulfil mainly mapping purposes and addresses only specific, noticeable buildings.

More information about the enumerations can be found on the INSPIRE Building Nature code list.

definition.en: Building unit(s) being part of the building.
The parcel(s) with which the building is officially associated.
Values indicating the condition of a construction.

usage.en: Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Condition of Construction code list.

definition.en: Date of validity of the document.

usage.en: EXAMPLES: the date the photo was taken, the date the sketch was done or approved, the date the building permit was accepted

definition.en: Any document providing information about the building.
Any document providing information about the building unit.
A short text providing overview of the document content. May be just title of the document.
Element where the elevation was measured.

usage.en: Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Elevation Reference code list.

definition.en: Value of the elevation.
Date and time when the event ended.
The location where the building can be entered or exited.
The location where the building unit can be entered or exited.
Reference to an external information system containing any piece of information related to the spatial object.
2D or 2.5D geometric representation of the building.
Representation of the outer boundary by a Multi Surface, which may - in contrast to a solid representation - not be topologically clean. In particular, the ground surface may be missing.
Representation of the outer boundary by a solid.
Height above ground.
Element used as the high reference.

usage.en:
EXAMPLE: The height of the building has been captured up to the top of building.

Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Elevation Reference code list.

definition.en: The estimated absolute positional accuracy of the (X,Y) coordinates of the building geometry.
Element that was captured by the (X,Y) coordinates of the LoD2 MultiSurface or Solid geometry.

usage.en:
Example: footprint, roof edge.

Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Horizontal Geometry Reference code list.

definition.en: Uniform Resource Identifier of the external information system.
The name of the external information system.

usage.en: EXAMPLES: Danish Register of Dwellings, Spanish Cadastre

definition.en: The nature of the internal installation.
The interior installation(s) serving the building.
The legal use of the building.
The legal use of the building unit.
Element as the low reference.

usage.en: EXAMPLE: the height of the building has been captured from its the lowest ground point.

definition.en: Name of the building
Qualitative information enabling to discern which credit should be given to the name with respect to its standardisation and/or its topicality.

usage.en: NOTE The Geographical Names application schema does not explicitly make a preference between different names (e.g. official endonyms) of a specific real world entity. The necessary information for making the preference (e.g. the linguistic status of the administrative or geographic area in question), for a certain use case, must be obtained from other data or information sources. For example, the status of the language of the name may be known through queries on the geometries of named places against the geometry of administrative units recorded in a certain source with the language statuses information. Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Name Status code list.

definition.en: Information enabling to acknowledge if the name is the one that is/was used in the area where the spatial object is situated at the instant when the name is/was in use.

usage.en: Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Nativeness code list.

definition.en: Number of dwellings. A dwelling is a residential unit which may consist of one or several rooms designed for the occupation of households.
Total number of building layers above ground, viewed across all building sections.

usage.en: This starts usually from the level where the main entrance is located.

definition.en: Total number of building layers under ground, viewed across all building sections.

usage.en: This starts usually from the level where the main entrance is located.

definition.en: The proportion of the building, given as a percentage, devoted to this current use.
Thematic identifier of the spatial object or of any piece of information related to the spatial object.
The geometry to be taken into account by view services, for portrayal.

Original data source from which the geographical name is taken from and integrated in the data set providing/publishing it. For some named spatial objects it might refer again to the publishing data set if no other information is available.
The status of the document, i.e. this attribute indicates if the document comes from official source or not.
A proper way of writing the geographical name.
Date and time when the event begun.
The way the height has been captured.
Identifier of the object broken down into its parts.
Line or multi-line where the spatial object touches the terrain representation.
The current use of a building.

usage.en: Example: trade, entertainment, ...

definition.en: Standard units of measurements used when accounting for stock, and expressing them in quantities.

usage.en: Concepts of this codelist should be used from the EU Vocabulary Measurement unit.

definition.en: Value of the height above ground.
The estimated absolute positional accuracy of the Z-coordinate of the building geometry.

usage.en: Absolute positional accuracy is defined as the mean value of the positional uncertainties for a set of positions where the positional uncertainties are defined as the distance between a measured position and what is considered as the corresponding true position.

definition.en: Element of the building that was captured by vertical coordinates.

usage.en: Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Elevation Reference code list.

definition.en: Height level to which the lower height of the model (Z-value of the lower horizontal polygon) refers to.

usage.en: Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Elevation Reference code list.

definition.en: Height level to which the upper height of the model (Z-value of the upper horizontal polygon) refers to.

usage.en:
Example: generalRoof, lowestRoof edge.

Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Elevation Reference code list.

definition.en: A portion of Belgian territory, geographically demarcated and identified by the AAPD on the cadastral plot plan, corresponding to the land area of one or more cadastral patrimonial plots.
A 3-dimensional geometric primitive.
Holder of the coordinates of a position in a coordinate reference system.
A MultiCurve is a 1-dimensional GeometryCollection whose elements are Curves.
A MultiSurface is a 2-dimensional GeometryCollection whose elements are Surfaces, all using coordinates from the same coordinate reference system.
A 0-dimensional geometrical primitive.
Surface consisting of one outer boundary and 0 or more inner boundaries. Each internal boundary forms a hole in the polygon.
A URI that is technically represented as a class in RDF, but is a literal in use.
A linear sequence of characters, words, or other data.
Values indicating the nature of a building.

usage.en: More information about the enumerations can be found: https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/BuildingNatureValue

definition.en: Values indicating the current use.

usage.en: More information can be found: https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/CurrentUseValue

definition.en: The way something is measured.
The status of the sources
Code list for the possible values of the nature of an internal installation.
Information used to uniquely identify an object.

usage.en: The basic assumption here is that this string is assigned by an organization and that this is done according to a well-defined system.

definition.en: More readable representation with only the basic data of the address, intended to use an address as an attribute of another object.
Shape and position characteristics of an object.
This data types includes the geometry in 2D or 2.5D of the building and metadata information about which element of the building was captured and how.
Any document providing information about a building or building unit.

usage.en: EXAMPLES: the building permit, a photo of facade or inner yard, a sketch of interior, the building code, the energy performance assessment, an emergency plan

definition.en: Link to the agent who issued the identifier.
Time when the identifier was issued.
Officially assigned alphanumeric code added to the house number to distinguish multiple building units, pitches, moorings or plots that have the same house number.
Alphanumeric code officially assigned to building units, berths, pitches or parcels.

usage.en: This can be very broad. An option is only the house number 19, but can also include options to specify the block, floor and number of an apartment, such as A.01.001

definition.en: The name or names of a unit of administration where a Member State has and/or exercises jurisdictional rights, for local, regional and national governance.
Country in which the address is located.
Municipal name of the address.
Address from which the address representation is derived.
Geometry expressed in gml format.
Direct position expressed in gml format.
Geometry expressed in wkt format.
Direct position expressed in wkt format.
The way the point was determined.
The way the point was determined.
String used to uniquely identify the object.

usage.en: Type of the string refers to the identifier (incl its version), the string itself to the actual identifier.

definition.en: Identifier of the Building.
The unique identifier of a building unit.

External unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may
be used by external applications to reference the spatial object.
Name of the agent who assigned the identifier.
The address linked to the location of the entrance.
Holder of the coordinates of a position in a coordinate reference system.
Name of a geographical area or locality that groups a number of addressable objects for the purpose of addressing them without the area or locality being an administrative unit.
Highest Administrative Unit of address, usually a country.
The region of the address, usually a province or state or similar area typically comprising several towns.
The complete address in one string, formatted or not.
Shape and position characteristics of a building.
Shape and position characteristics of a building unit.
3D geometric representation of the internal installation.
Alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies the address locator within the street, administrative unit, etc.
Name or description of the geographic object that the address locator identifies.
PO Box number in a post office.
Code designating the geographical area that groups addresses for postal purposes.
Name designating the geographical area that groups addresses for postal purposes.
Streetname of the address.
Number with a scale.
The address representation that corresponds to the building.
The address representation that corresponds to the building unit.
